snippet: A deal was reached with the family of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells became critical in research after her death from cancer in 1951.
abstract: Deal is reached with family of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells became critical in research after her death from cervical cancer in 1951; in 62 years since her death, Lacks's cells have been subject of more than 74,000 studies, many of which have yielded profound insights into cell biology, vaccines, in vitro fertilization and cancer; deal grants Lacks's family some control over how her genome is used.
lead_paragraph: A deal was reached with the family of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells became critical in research after her death from cancer in 1951.

headline.main: A Family Consents to a Medical Gift, 62 Years Later
headline.print_headline: Family Gets Role in Use of ‘Immortal Life’ Cells

keywords.value: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works
